creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: vantage point taken from snowy cliff with snow-covered pine trees; looking down onto snow-covered rooftops at LL; snow-covered land with trees and a few buildings in middle ground; rolling low mountain with trees and snow in background
inscription: Left: [自刻　一九五五年作　妙高温泉] {Jikoku, 1954nen saku, ?????}; bottom: [Myoko Hot Spring], in pencil: [Toshi Yoshida]
markings: LLC: Red artist\'s seal [吉田遠] {Yoshida Tō}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Myōkō Hot Springs
